column5: We'll be there from the 15th to 22nd. Figure the speck lake trip will be Saturday.....  PM me a cell phone number...
wasn't it Joe with the pink gloves...  we may see you up there   every time I check we are staying longer    what is it now, feb 15 till march 3rd...LOL
Yah it was.. but you had a nice outfit toooo
just covering up the important parts
if you guys stay up untill may 29th ill see you again for the spring fish..lol
yeah that's what I mean. if we can't get to that speck lake, I should stay in the cottage and cook
but
when it works
it really works  I kept trying to post and when I could access the site again all my tries posted
No need to make your point over and over again...
hey wayne he probably means camp adanac on temagami island should right off the ice rd to bear island
Yah that makes sense malcolm. Have you talked to Rick lately.. re the thickness of the ice road and up into his place in Spawning??
OK fellas . you're killin me here ... speck lakes ...jeesh .. if you need an extra hand just say the word  Hey Wayne ... just wondering if you know Dennis Wicary ... he's on an Island up your way
Name don't ring a bell Jon !  ..and you have a PM
only 11 more sleeps and 8 days of Temagami fishing here I come. GOT MY TWO SIGNS ALL READY. I'm not Joe and I'm not terry lol
I have that feeling Terry's gonna put on a show this year Lloyd!     ..otherwise the diver won't get paid!
and I have mine  for simcoe...   .I'm not Lloyd
I do the cooking and cleaning of fish you do the dishes lol i think Wayne has pics to show that lol Terry this is going to be the best trip yet. wait till you see what i got for you lol
funny you say that i put mine in my pack for simcoe too lol look forward to seeing you out on the ice sat Terry.
A word of advice Terry. Pack a wrap around apron for the times you're  standing at the sink. A float suit would be better though....

well guys my trip has been moved up a week i was going on the 26th now ill be there 19th..cant wait feels like it will never arrive..i see a few of you just cant wait a day after the 15th.. i dont blame you..i hope you will leave some fish for me and my pals..not so worried about terry i see he never does that well  ..well all i can say is you guys suck i wish i could be there on the opener and you suck suck suck....there i feel better now..
I hear you Roy  Lloyd, if what you got for me starts with KY, I just don't want to hear it    see it     feel it  or  touch it   or for god sakes, think about it.............
That's not what they mean by the ice is dangerous Terry !! lol
lol Terry your starting to make me wonder lol
Me too.. I think I'll stay home and fish the bay instead.... the keys are above....
not for a couple of weeks but i know his plane is done and it looks really good
Hey... leave me out of this... LOL Teryy, i still have those pink rubber gloves... you can borrow them any time! HH
the last time a guy wore gloves around me he was looking up my cornhole...the gloves were'nt pink.. terry ever think of getting a nice rod and reel to match those pink gloves..lol
LOL Rob.. maybe we'll actually cross paths this year ! Which fine establishment are you staying at this time???

staying at friends place on bear island..will be there feb 19th..would be my pleasure wayne to hook up with you and a few of your buddies on here, sound like a great bunch..i like staying on bear or close to it..most of the area's i fish seem to be closer from bear.. i think the furthest i have fished up your way was the brooms.. i have had great fun at the brooms in the summers and have had some luck on the ice...
Anyone heading up to Temagami in the next few days ,  be aware of ice:  http://ottertooth.com/Temagami/News/10/sat10-03.htm
I have ben up north a few times recently, and I  saw a few lakes with open water still and alot with sketchy ice. Thanks for the update.

Sometimes I wonder what they're thinking.. Pigeau should have know better all considered and the fact that there was immense amounts of open water on the lake on Christmas Eve (and there still is). There are many that rip across on as little as an inch of ice to get to the mine landing early into freeze up. One hickup.. water in the fuel.. belt blowing.. getting to slow can = disaster. Even in the sheltered bay to my place I would have walked out to our camp at Christmas...and never considered a sled this year. Last year.. I drove the F150 to the dock, on the 22nd of December, as a comparison.  Good to hear the ice road is at least in to Bear... but anyone considering travelling it to go fishing.. don't get off of it into the snow... you won't find much ice there ! I bet they've been flooding the ice road to build the thickness up.
You think even walking off the road would be out of the question, Wayne?

Shouldn't be an issue John.. just don't drive off of it. If you want to fish our end of the lake... you can drive to my dock and park there and walk out from there. Doug has the road plowed to my dock and my "parking lot".
Still dangerous lads
Wayne..you shouldn't be flying too much at that altitude...can't be good for the lungs
I'll be doing it again Thursday Morning Rick... 30,000 feet.. south bound !
Good to know!! Thanks for that, Wayne
Shots Ron Miller took yesterday.  Devils bay is still open    3 inches of fresh ice off Rabbit Nose Island finally    Mathias bringing up the Christmas sled..

Thanks for the pics, irishfield.  Those pictures remind me of a question I had in my mind. How do they hook up to lost vehicles/sleds?  Take for instance the guy whose truck went into Nipissing (i think that was the lake) at 29 ft depth. I'd imagine they'd need divers or underwater cameras or something to hook on to the truck effectively and avoiding as much more damage to the truck as possible.  Any ideas?
Some lucky bugger goes swimming !

The recovery took 10 days from begining to end on Nipissing. They had to flood the ice for a few days to thicken things up before they could do anything . Bartletts towing in N-bay does the extractions, they have pics on their website. They have/hire a diver to go down and hook the vehicle up. Roughly $25,000 for the extraction! play safe!! Thanks for the updates on Temagami, gonna be up there a few times once lakers open. Thrasher
Very cool! A direct link to those interested in the process:  Bartlett's Towing Ice & Lake Recovery
Any new reports on the ice yet.  Heading up on opening weekend of trout.

Thanks to snow and milder temps.. not a lot new, but I suspect the majority of the lake is safe for a sled. I wouldn't be driving anywhere off the beaten path in a vehicle. I have 14 " at my dock, so we can drive out at least to my place. Will be all sledding from there.  Lake was a slushy mess last week.. anywhere off the beaten sled trail. Hopefully that has melted down and solidified before we all get up there.  "Opening weekend" You realize they open on a Monday correct?... the 15th...when we'll be drilling hole after hole after hole...

Ya we are going up on saturday or sunday. We will be staying at Camp Advance.  Last year we drove the truck and trailer right there. But may not do that this year.  I have a dodge diesel and a big enclosed trailer.  Not sure if I would put that out on 14 inches of Ice just not worth it.  It kind of sucks that you can not fish trout till monday but you can do other fish till that time.  Sure is hard though when you get a nice trout and have to through it back
Whom is Camp Advanced on the lake??

I believe that the guys name is Lance White.  We stayed there last year for the first time and he was very nice and reasonable.  I just wanted to get a feel to see if the ice would be good enough to go out on with the truck and trailer.  Would not want to become a stat

Supposed to be about -20 for the next 6 or 7 nights... so if the slush tightens up it may produce some ice. Call him before you go and I'm sure he'll give you the up to date. I do the same for my own place.. neighbour lives there full time.. and keeps my road plowed and parking area clean so the ice can build. If need be he floods the road to build thickness, but can't this winter as he busted his leg up in November...just before ice in.
we'd better have good ice........ could be along week if not
ITS A LONG WEEK FOR YOU ANYWAYS FROM THE PAST TRIPS LOL
yeah that's what I mean. if we can't get to that speck lake, I should stay in the cottage and cook
so I am having trouble with this website
lots of trouble
